column4: any suggestions on what to do if it says i dont have enough space on /var/cache/apt/archives when i try to update
try du -hs /* to find out where your stuff is so you can clean out some stuff
1.3 gigs in /usr, 108 megs /var, 86 megs in lib, 35 m in /etc, 8.1 m in /sbin
all seems normal... what does df -h give for free space?
how big is the drive that you have this on?
did you try sudo apt-get clean ?
you will probably need to uninstall some things... you only have about a 2 gig disk right?
should have formatted stupid windos partition
you don't really need it for a server right?
dpkg -l will tell you have installed
then you can go through and uninstall with apt-get remove
